If you’ve claimed your free GMB profile, you’re on the right track. Make sure you follow that up with stellar optimization and promotion. Here’s a guide to help you get started!

How to Optimize Your Google My Business Listing

Don’t Leave Any Section Unfilled

As one of the best practices for Google My Business optimization, detailing works like a charm. Start by ensuring NAP (name, address, and phone number) accuracy and consistency. Your Google My Business profile should feature the same NAP that’s on your website, social media pages, business card, and online listings.

Make sure there’s no inconsistency. Each hyphen, asterisk, and number should be consistent across the board. This is a great way to add a touch of legitimacy to your listing, which will help you make your way to one of the coveted ranks of the Google 3-Pack.

Once you’ve taken care of the basics, take a quick look at your profile. Are there any unfilled sections? In many cases, businesses fill out the basics and leave the details for later. If you’ve resorted to the same approach, undo the damage, stat.

Your Google My Business profile should be accurately filled out. Focus on these details:

  • Website
  • Business hours
  • Category
  • Description
  • Attributes
  • Questions and answers
  • Reviews

Some details are consumer-generated, including questions and answers and reviews. But don’t wait for your audience to take care of them. Instead, adopt a proactive approach and prompt customers to leave reviews (more on this later).

Here’s a glimpse of a meticulously completed Google My Business listing:

Google’s algorithm expertly crawls, indexes, and ranks listings based on the accuracy, consistency, quality, and comprehensiveness of the information provided.

If your profile features information that checks off these boxes, you have a better shot at appearing among the top search results for local searches. Over time, this optimization trick will help you engage and convert more local customers, resulting in bigger and better sales.

Share Engaging Posts on a Weekly Basis

Consistency is inarguably one of the best Google My Business tricks you’ll stumble across. While you may have filled out your profile like a seasoned pro, posting every once in a while will take a toll on your rankings. Instead, make sure you share engaging, unique, and value-added posts on a weekly basis.

Include a CTA (call-to-action) toward the end of each post to prompt action. You can also post about special discounts, clearance sales, and ongoing offers to redirect your target audience to your site.

Sharing content more frequently will help you boost your online presence and stand out from the crowd—both literally and figuratively.

Google doesn’t accept posts that are longer than 300 words, so stick to the word limit. Strike the perfect balance between brevity and value to ensure each post packs a powerful punch. Remember, there are no bounds here. You can choose to post about anything: a new product/service launch, a milestone, behind-the-scenes footage, exclusive offers, etc.

Get started on optimizing your Google My Business Listing!
Call 855-444-4777 now

Use High-Ranking Keywords

Using keywords is part and parcel of targeting a local audience. If your keyword research strategy is subpar, take active measures to turn things around.

Start by identifying industry-specific keywords like “legal support,” “plumbing services,” “interior design,” etc. Based on your industry, shortlist 5–10 relevant keywords with high search volume. In addition, research location-specific keywords based on where you offer your products/services.

Once you’ve covered these two key bases, compile a list of relevant trending keywords. Are there certain holidays, events, or pop culture references that are trending in your area? Think “Christmas,” “Valentine’s Day,” “Super Bowl,” and the like.

Anything and everything that’s a hot trend goes! And if it’s relevant to your industry, you’ve struck gold. For instance, sharing a Ken Bone-themed post to promote red shirts would’ve been a genius move for apparel stores in 2016.

Once you have a set of winning keywords, use them on your profile and in your posts. But don’t go overboard. Keyword stuffing can put you at risk of getting penalized by Google. The right balance will help you target a wide local audience and boost your listing.

It’s also important to note that Google highlights relevant keywords in reviews. Here’s an example:

Sounds like something that cannot be leveraged, right? Well, not quite. Requesting specific reviews is a great way to give Google exactly what it needs to rank your listing in the Google 3-Pack.

For instance, if you run a restaurant, ask customers for feedback regarding your customer service, specific menu items, ambiance, etc. This will help you generate reviews that are right up Google’s alley.

The outcome? A listing that ranks higher and generates more local traffic in the long run.

Answer Pending Questions

Questions and answers can make or break a Google My Business listing. Let’s say you’re looking for 24/7 packing and moving services in New York. If a business has specifically answered a question about 24/7 availability, it’ll show up among the top search results. You can easily browse through multiple listings and choose the right option based on the specific Q&As provided.

This neat trick helps customers save time and businesses attract the right audience. Make sure your Google My Business profile is replete with relevant Q&As. We suggest searching for industry-specific FAQs and listing your own Q&As accordingly.

In addition, make sure you answer relevant questions that are posted on your profile. However, avoid responding to each question. This will help you steer clear of repetition. You’ll also manage to weed out irrelevant questions.

Here are some examples to steer you in the right direction:

Post High-Quality Audiovisual Content

If your Google My Business profile doesn’t feature high-quality images and videos, you’ll struggle to make a winning impact on your audience. From the cover photo to the videos, the audiovisual content featured on your page should be a treat for your audience! You can also provide a 360-degree street view for a better look at your outlet.

Showcase your products/services, share company culture videos, and capture some behind-the-scenes footage to give your audience the ultimate experience before they get a chance to transact with you. The better the content, the better your chances of making great sales!

Sharing high-quality content will also help you improve brand identity and recall, resulting in enhanced audience retention in the long run. As always, update photos and videos on a bi-yearly basis. If certain images don’t reflect your business anymore, make sure you post a fresh batch of content and indicate the changes (renovations, etc.).

Engage With Customer Reviews

When it comes to optimizing your Google My Business page, leveraging reviews is your best bet. Reviews carry massive conversion potential. They add an air of legitimacy to your business, resulting in better engagement and sales.

Here’s how you can make the most of them. Start by requesting more reviews through your website, social media pages, and online listings. You can also create a specific page for reviews on your website. Hyperlink said page in the CTAs for your blogs, articles, and online posts. You can also send a link to your audience via email for better reach!

If you’re still struggling to generate plentiful positive reviews, incentivize customers by offering discounts. While this may sound a little over-the-top, it’s essential. Ensuring a steady stream of flattering reviews will help you snag a spot on the Google 3-Pack and skyrocket conversions.

Apart from going the extra mile to request reviews, we also recommend engaging with each review for better reach. Thank your audience for leaving positive reviews and promise to make amends with regard to negative reviews (make sure you follow through).

Over time, you can also begin to request specific reviews to highlight different aspects of your business. Keep industry-specific keywords in mind! Based on the search preferences of your target audience, request relevant reviews to help Google showcase your business.

Once you get the hang of this powerful strategy, it’ll become second nature to you. Not only will you marvel at the results, but you’ll also wonder why it took you so long to kick-start a strategy that’s so simple.

Set Up Messaging

Enabling messaging is a great way to make it easier for your audience to reach you. Customers can directly send you text messages and receive prompt replies to their queries. As you break down the barriers in business–customer communication, you’ll manage to facilitate more transactions.

In many cases, web users end up delaying a potential purchase because they’re in a state of limbo. No matter how specific your Q&As may be, you can’t cover all the bases. It’s very likely that certain web users will still require answers to unique queries. Setting up messaging will help you cover these gaps and make your listing more responsive.

Leverage Special Attributes

Based on your industry and business, you have the option of leveraging special attributes to make your business more discoverable. Here’s an example:

These attributes play a big role in allowing web users to choose the right business among a pool of relevant listings.

As a rule of thumb, make sure you get as specific as possible. If your outlet offers free Wi-Fi, include it as a special attribute on your Google My Business listing!

Featuring a set of highly-specific special attributes will help your listing stand out.

How to Promote Your Google My Business Listing

While optimizing your Google My Business page is important, it’s not the be-all and end-all of mastering local visibility.

In addition to optimization, make sure you have a razor-sharp focus on promotion.

Here are some of the best Google My Business promotion strategies to help you get off on the right foot:

  • Start by creating and sharing a link to your listing (click here). Once you’ve set up a unique URL for your Google My Business listing, you can share it with your customers to request reviews or boost your profile.
  • Make sure your website features links to your Google reviews and directions. This is a neat trick to help your listing get more traction!
  • While you may feel tempted to experiment with spammy tactics, avoid them at all costs. You’ll risk getting penalized by Google. Instead, focus on organic growth.
  • Google My Business frequently releases new tools. Explore the Google Marketing Kit to give your listing an edge.

Wrapping Up!

We’ve walked you through the top strategies to optimize your business for local search. We also covered some tips to help you promote your business on Google.

If you’re ready to put this plan into action, we can help you change the game! Have questions about optimizing your GMB listing? Call 855-444-4777 or fill out the form below and let’s create a customized plan that fits your unique requirements! We’re ready when you are!

item.content:encoded:
While digital marketing has been the cornerstone of running a successful local business for at least a decade, its importance has grown manifold in 2020.

Why?

According to research, the COVID-19 lockdown has pushed internet use by a whopping 70%!

And that’s not all.

While the lockdown has begun to ease across many states, people are still spending an astounding amount of time browsing the web for local content/products/services.

If you’ve been overlooking the importance of digitalizing your business, you may want to jump on the bandwagon. And while adopting digitalization is a great way to get started, it’s not enough.

According to Forbes, 75% of internet users never scroll past the first SERP (search engine result page).

If your content isn’t optimized, engaging, and gripping, it’s most likely to show up on the 12th, 13th or even 40th SERP. With an average attention span of eight seconds, people barely glance over the first page, let alone scour the remaining SERPs—so you better get optimizing.

What do you do to stand out from the crowd and make a stellar first impression?

It’s simple. You optimize your content for the Google 3-Pack.

Sounds odd, doesn’t it?

We’ll help break things down so you can leverage the 3-Pack to rank locally on Google.

Let’s dive in!

What is the Local SEO 3-Pack?

Simply put, the Google 3-Pack is a listing of the top three search results for a local search.

While a regular search doesn’t include geographic keywords, a local search commonly includes the phrases “near me,” “close to me,” or “in [location].”

For instance, if you search for “Italian restaurants in Manhattan,” you’ll receive the following Google 3-Pack:

Similarly, if you search for “barbershop in Downtown Los Angeles,” you’ll see the following Google 3-Pack:

Notice how the 3-Pack covers every base to give internet users comprehensive—albeit concise—information about the most relevant, popular, and reputable local search results.

With a simple search, people can instantly access the following information about the top three businesses:

  • Name
  • Address
  • Phone number
  • Introductory image
  • Map with personalized directions
  • Link to website
  • Rating
  • Number of reviews
  • Timings
  • Key features (e.g. dine-in, delivery, curbside pickup, etc.)

If they choose to engage with the listing, they can view even more details, including:

  • Additional images
  • FAQs
  • Popular times
  • Detailed critic reviews and testimonials
  • Amenities
  • Pricing
  • Booking options

In short, the Google 3-Pack is an efficient, accurate, and time-saving gold mine for local searchers.

Over the years, Google reduced the number of topmost local searches from seven to five. In 2015, the pack was further condensed by reducing five listings to three for enhanced convenience, ease, and relevance.

It’s no surprise that the search results on the first page of Google generate a whopping 92% of organic traffic. In fact, the first result in the Google 3-Pack enjoys an enviable 34.36% CTR (click-through rate).

Customers are less likely to engage with results that show up underneath the Google 3-Pack. While search results on the first page that fall outside the 3-Pack still generate a lot of traffic, the second, third, and subsequent pages suffer from diminishing traffic generation.

That’s why we’ve rounded up some of the most effective and whip-smart SEO strategies to help your business rank higher on Google Maps, so it can show up on the coveted Google 3-Pack.

How to Optimize for the Google 3-Pack?

1. Check Where You Currently Stand

It should come as no surprise that the Google 3-Pack appears 93% of the time when people run a local search.

If you run a local business, optimizing your content to rank locally on Google is essential. And checking where your business currently stands is a great way to kick things off.

While you may feel compelled to dive into the deep end of 3-Pack optimization, forgoing prior research could end up doing more harm than good.

Instead, we suggest consulting with SEO experts to determine whether your business appears in the top 20 local search results. This will help streamline and refine the optimization strategy for your business.

2. Claim, Fill, and Optimize Your Google My Business Listing

Leveraging Google My Business is one of the most effective ways to rank higher on Google Maps.

As Google’s own in-house platform, Google My Business makes it much easier for customers to find, access, and engage with your business.

If you haven’t claimed your free listing yet, we suggest tackling that task first by clicking here. Simply enter your company’s name or add your business to Google if it isn’t already in the directory.

Once you’ve claimed your listing, take your time to fill out the required information. Take special care to ensure accuracy and relevance, as this information will potentially appear in the Google 3-Pack.

You’ll be requested to share your company’s:

  • Name
  • Address
  • Phone number
  • Website URL
  • Industry category
  • Images
  • Business hours
  • Types of payment accepted
  • Description

The more information you provide, the greater your chances of showing up on the Google 3-Pack.

Ensure NAP (name, address, phone number) consistency to lend legitimacy and credibility to your business. Any deviations could reduce the authority of your business and prevent customers from accessing information or finding your listing altogether.

Once you’ve filled in the relevant information, the real work begins.

Optimizing and updating your listing are two of the most impactful ways to help your business climb SERPs.

Share high-resolution images and upload photos on a weekly basis to ensure relevance and keep your audience engaged. According to Google, businesses with photos enjoy 42% more requests for directions to their location and 35% more clicks to their website.

Cover different areas of your business, including the storefront and variegated interior angles.

Make sure important details like the hours of operation are up to date. Maximizing relevance will go a long way in improving the visitor-to-lead conversion rate.

We suggest browsing through our earlier blog titled “How to Optimize Google My Business Listing and Leverage It for More Sales” for more insights.

3. Master the Art of On-Page SEO to Rank Locally on Google

Neglecting on-page SEO is one of the most common mistakes that land small-scale local businesses in hot water.

Google uses over 200 unique factors in their algorithm to rank websites. Creating a strong on-page SEO strategy can easily help you check most of these off your list!

For example, most small business owners don’t know that they can increase their chances of appearing in Google 3-Pack by improving their website’s loading time.

According to a recent study, pages that load quickly rank significantly higher on SERPs. In fact, 79% of customers who have trouble with a website’s loading time admit that they won’t return to the site in the future.

Here are some easy strategies to help speed up your website:

  • Minify CSS, JavaScript, and HTML
  • Minimize HTTP requests
  • Reduce server response time
  • Opt for the right host (shared hosting, VPS hosting, dedicated server)
  • Enable browser caching
  • Compress images and optimize files
  • Use a CDN (content delivery network)

In addition, optimize your content by using relevant keywords, title tags, meta description, headlines, header tags, short descriptive URLs, and alt text.

These strategies will go a long way in helping your business rank higher on Google Maps.

4. Attract a Plethora of High-Quality, Positive Reviews for Your Business

While leveraging reviews may sound like one of the least actionable strategies to help your business show up on the Google 3-Pack, it’s surreptitiously one of the most effective.

In fact, a whopping 84% of customers trust online reviews just as much as personal recommendations!

Click on any listing in the Google 3-Pack, and you’ll come across a plethora of critic and customer reviews.

Here’s an extended view of a high-end restaurant (The Modern) that showed up in the Google 3-Pack:

In a nutshell, Google loves reviews.

Why?

Because customers trust them and heavily rely on them!

If your business has a high number of positive reviews, you’ll earn a great ranking on Google My Business. This ranking, in turn, will help you climb up SERPs and earn a spot in the Google 3-Pack.

Remember, Google is constantly vetting relevant businesses to find the most reputable options that help customers have a great experience.

If your business has a poor ranking of 2.6/5, for example, the chances are that you’ll get stuck in the back end of SERPs.

Turn that around by boosting your ranking and you’ll instantly maximize your chances of showing up in the Google 3-Pack.

But how do you go about this?

By requesting reviews.

According to a recent survey, over 97% of customers engage with online reviews for local businesses. While customers prioritize reading reviews, they also understand the importance of offering reviews.

Here are some ways you can earn quality reviews for your business:

  • Send a courteous and engaging email to customers, requesting a review for products/services they recently used. Opting for a personalized approach will increase your chances of receiving a timely and positive review.
  • Create a “Review Us” page on your website. When customers interact with the link, they should be redirected to your Google Review URL. This is a great way to ensure the reviews increase your chances of taking a spot in Google’s 3-Pack.
  • Use a QR code creatively to redirect customers to your Google Review page. Click here to generate a QR code using a free tool.

5. Create Engaging, Unique, and Value-Added Local Content

Creating local content and tweaking product/service pages by incorporating local keywords is a powerful way to rank locally on Google.

We suggest using Google Keyword Planner or getting in touch with SEO experts to identify and effectively use local keywords.

In addition, create content around local events, holidays, news, and trending topics to ensure you reach a wide local audience. Optimizing your content for local search will ultimately help your business rank higher and tap into diverse local demographics.

Of course, don’t lose sight of ensuring that the content is engaging, informative, and compelling. No matter how well your local SEO strategy may be, producing subpar content that doesn’t strike a chord with your target audience will take you back to square one.

Instead, fuse quality with local SEO to create and execute a winning content marketing strategy.

We suggest focusing on creating high-quality and optimized:

  • Blogs
  • Articles
  • Guest posts
  • Regional pages
  • Product pages
  • Service pages
  • Press releases
  • Infographics and instructographics
  • Videos

6. Claim External Review Sites

Popular external review sites like Yelp, Foursquare, Tripadvisor, Trustpilot, and Yellowpages are vital sources of traffic for your business. Each review on an external review site signals to Google to boost SERP rankings for your business.

We recommend browsing through each platform’s specific review guidelines to ensure compliance.

Once the reviews start pouring in, you’ll notice an increase in audience engagement and retention. Consistent positive reviews will help your business climb SERPs and earn a spot on the Google 3-Pack.

7. Earn Local Backlinks From Websites With High Domain Authority

Link building is undeniably one of the most effective ways to get your business on the map.

Simply put, link building is the process of acquiring backlinks from third-party websites.

For instance, if a non-competitor in your industry links to your content or product/service pages, you earn a backlink.

Why is this important?

Earning a valuable backlink from a website with a high domain authority is a surefire way to attract quality traffic. As their readers are redirected to your content, you’ll successfully manage to tap into a wide audience base.

While this means more revenue, it also means higher chances of breaking into the Google 3-Pack in the long run!

Here are some advanced link building tips and tricks to help you get started!

8. Create a Mobile-Friendly Website

78% of all local mobile searches result in a purchase. As smartphones become the epicenter of the modern world, creating a mobile-friendly website is imperative.

If your website isn’t mobile-friendly, you’ll fail to target the large majority of Gen Z, millennials, and Gen X customers.

We suggest opting for clean yet appealing graphics, user-friendliness, and eye-catching CTAs (call-to-actions).

In fact, mobile-friendliness also helps Google determine the quality and legitimacy of your business. If your website isn’t mobile-friendly, there’s no reason for Google to include it in the 3-Pack. The last thing Google wants is to receive negative feedback from customers who interacted with a business in the 3-Pack that didn’t have a mobile-friendly website.

10. Local SEO Services and Google Map Optimization Services for the Win!

Consulting the pros is a tried-and-tested way of optimizing for the Google 3-Pack.

If you’ve been dissatisfied with your SERP rankings, we can help turn things around.

As the leading digital marketing experts in Los Angeles, we offer expert local SEO services and Google Maps optimization services across the globe.

Whether you run a small business, recently launched a start-up, or can’t seem to effectively market a large company, we can help you get started.

Our SEO experts have extensive experience in helping clients climb SERPs and earn a spot on the Google 3-Pack. We’ll help your business rank higher on Google Maps so you can reap the benefits of high-quality traffic, high conversions, low customer attrition, and great sales.

Call us at 855-444-4777 to get started!

We also offer award-winning paid marketing, content marketing, website design and development, social media management, and reputation management services.

item.content:encoded:
While you may have developed an excellent marketing strategy with a strong focus on social media optimization and diverse marketing, overlooking the importance of optimizing your Google My Business listing is a big faux pas that could cause your metrics to plummet.

So what exactly is Google My Business?

It’s a free online tool for organizations and businesses to help them manage their online presence through Google, among Google properties such as Google Maps and Google Search.

Basically, it helps customers find your business and helps you tell them your business’s story. To make your listing more legitimate, you can even verify your Google My Business listing.

With over 90% of Americans owning a cell phone, tapping into the depths of online directories has become one of the easiest ways to boost audience reach, engagement, and retention.

Let’s look at it this way:

Are you constantly on the lookout for new restaurants to try with your beau or family?

Do you jump at the thought of stumbling upon unique tech-savvy products that make your life easier?

Does the thought of coming across an affordable and trendy local online clothing store make you grin from ear to ear?

If you answered at least one of these questions in the affirmative, Google My Business has already impacted your life for the better.

If you’ve ever sought out a business that can help you meet your needs on Google, Google My Business has helped you find that business.

Like you, the majority of American consumers are actively seeking modern solutions to their needs—both consciously and subconsciously.

And let’s face it—nobody wants to crank open the yellow pages to find businesses that offer their desired products or services.

This is where Google My Business steps in.

By creating a profile laden with operating information and engaging text, photo, and video posts, businesses can give customers exactly what they’re looking for—and more.

With over 97% of U.S. consumers using online platforms to shop locally, Google My Business is the most popular and effective online tool for businesses to leverage in 2020.

But how do you kick things off?

Start by creating a Google My Business Account To Optimize For Greater Brand Visibility

Each month, Google receives:

  • Over 5 million searches for restaurants
  • Approximately 3 billion searches for hotels
  • 1 billion searches for clothing shops
  • Close to 600 million searches for cosmetic salons (hair, nails, makeup, skincare, and more)
  • 5 million searches for coffee shops

As the most popular, efficient, and easy-to-use search platform across the globe, Google offers businesses a plethora of opportunities to make their presence felt among consumers.

So give your brand visibility by getting on the map!

You can claim your business by creating a Google My Business listing.

We also recommend linking your profile to your Google Ads account to increase engagement on your ads. Once you’re done, your profile will show up whenever users run local search queries.

A study conducted by Google revealed that 50% of users who searched for a local business on their smartphone visited the store within a day. As you optimize your Google My Business profile, your business will begin to climb SERPs, thereby helping you reach a wider audience.

Despite this incredible advantage, over 56% of local retailers haven’t claimed their free Google My Business listing. If your business is part of this percentage, it may be time to give your brand the boost it deserves by creating an engaging, informative, and creative listing.

Include the following information:

  • Name
  • Address
  • Phone Number
  • Website
  • Business Hours
  • Category
  • Types of Payment Accepted
  • Description
  • Photos
  • Reviews
  • Frequently Asked Questions

Not only will an updated and relevant online listing help your business attract new customers, but it’ll also enhance credibility, reputability, and authenticity.

This will allow you to retain old customers and solidify your customer base, thereby boosting business metrics.

We also recommend applying for verification to utilize all the tools available on the GMB dashboard and enhance visibility across Google Search and Maps.

Increase local traffic by ensuring NAP (Name, Address, and Phone Number) consistency across your Google My Business profile, website, and social media platforms.

The consistency will add an air of professionalism to your business while helping users find accurate information across all digital platforms.

For instance, if your number is listed without area codes or prefixes (e.g., 1-800)on your website, it’s essential that your Google My Business page follows the same format.

Listing accuracy also establishes trust, making customers feel more inclined toward completing a transaction with certain businesses. Imagine opening a brand’s Google My Business page, only to be confronted with inconsistent information, informal writing, and slipshod uppercase and lowercase usage.

The informality is very likely to put you off and compel you to browse further until you find a competitor that may not have an equally impressive range of products but offers a seamless and professional Google My Business profile.

While these details may seem negligible, they have a transformative—albeit subconscious—effect on the consumer buying process.

Request Customer Reviews and Actively Respond to Them

Research indicates that over 91% of potential consumers read online reviews. Out of this, approximately 84% trust this information.

It goes without saying that customer reviews are a great way to increase brand reputability while doubling or tripling sales!

Leverage Google My Business by requesting reviews from your customers. You can do this by sending them a link via email or text. We also recommend actively responding to reviews—both positive and negative! Here’s how you could express your gratitude fora positive review:

Hi! Thank you for your feedback, [customer’s name]! We’re thrilled that you enjoyed our products/services. We look forward to delivering more quality products/services in the future and hope to see you again soon! It’s customers like you that keep us going. Hope you have a great day and continue to share your feedback with us in the future.

Not only will each customer feel individually appreciated, but they’ll also establish a virtual connection with the brand, thereby continuing to rely on their products/services. While you may feel compelled to leave negative reviews unanswered, responding to them in a diplomatic and reassuring manner is a great way to make things right.

Here’s a glimpse of how you could go about it:

Hi, [customer’s name]! We’re so sorry our products/services didn’t meet your expectations. While our product/service is great for normal skin, it can irritate sensitive or eczematic skin. Our product/service is a great alternative that’ll recalibrate your skin’s pH while promoting a fresh and rejuvenating glow. If you’d like to return your product/service, please get in touch with our customer service team, and we’ll process a replacement or return right away! Keep us in the loop so we can suggest the best-suited products/services for your skin type and ensure you have a great experience this time around!

Tact? Check. Excellent customer service? Double check!

Smart, empathetic, interactive, and remedial responses will undo the damage while highlighting positive Google My Business reviews. This practice will create healthy engagement on your page while making customers feel heard and properly tended to.

We recommend maintaining professionalism and courteousness to ensure customer satisfaction instead of driving away potential customers. When done right, healthy engagement will increase local traffic and help consumers feel safe and assured about proceeding with a purchase.

Thinking of creating a Google My Business account, only to abandon it within a few weeks? You may want to rethink that.

One of the most effective ways to leverage Google My Business is being consistent and investing a little bit of hard work that’s bound to go a long way. In addition, leaving your page unattended could prevent you from getting back to negative reviews and strengthen your brand identity.

Write an Engaging and SEO-Friendly Description

This helps improve your Google My Business rankings.

Imagine coming across your favorite home furnishing store only to be let down by a bleak description that offers little to no information. While your eclectic bohemian rug may have sparked joy, a drab description could be enough to leave a sour taste in your mouth that may alter your buying habits.

Customers are always seeking fresh, engaging, and invigorating content that informs them without making them doze off.

To attract audiences while boosting metrics, we recommend writing a witty, informative, and SEO-friendly description. Keep things short and fun to prevent consumers from losing interest—which is very likely since Microsoft revealed that the average attention span has dropped from 12 to 8 seconds.

Incorporate keywords that online searchers actively use. Not only will this increase local traffic, but it’ll also help customers find exactly what they’re looking for. If your description largely diverts from your products/services, it’s very likely that customers will feel frustrated upon encountering information that doesn’t meet their search requirements. Moreover, your listing may not even qualify for the top searches by virtue of its irrelevance.

Keep your description snappy, exciting, and SEO-friendly to ensure it shows up on Google Maps and helps customers find your location.

In short, your description should abide by the following rules:

  • No URLs/links
  • Focus on how your business stands out from the competition
  • Avoid keyword stuffing at all costs
  • Avoid adopting a heavily promotional tone
  • Including a phone number/email address is acceptable
  • Win customers over with ingenuity, wit, humor, and a concise yet compelling description!

Make the most of this feature by actively responding to queries, positive feedback, and constructive criticism. Google cleverly tracks average response time to help customers determine your response rate in advance.

Add a welcome message prior to engaging in the conversation to prevent leaving customers in a state of limbo. As an excellent way of promoting business transparency and boosting reputability, this feature will help your brand gain greater recognition and make its way to the top of search results!
